citation.article-title: Polyphasic classification of the genus Photorhabdus and proposal of new taxa: P. luminescens subsp. luminescens subsp. nov., P. luminescens subsp. akhurstii subsp. nov., P. luminescens subsp. laumondii subsp. nov., P. temperata sp. nov., P. temperata subsp. temperata subsp. nov. and P. asymbiotica sp. nov.

p.s: Photorhabdus luminescens (lu.mi.nes'cens. M.L. pres. part. luminescens luminescing; for its bioluminescence)
Cells are large rods (2-6 x 0.5-1.4 μm).
Bioluminescent, with bioluminescence more than 100-fold greater in phase I.
Maximum temperature for growth in nutrient broth is 35-39°C.
Most strains produce acid weakly from fructose, N-acetylglucosamine, glucose, glycerol, maltose, mannose, ribose and trehalose.
Proteinaceous inclusions in phase I cell protoplasm, produced poorly in phase II.
The natural habitat is the intestinal lumen of entomopathogenic nematodes of the species H. bacteriophora (Brecon and HP88 sub-groups) and H. indica.
This species is divided into three subspecies.
The type strain (HbT) is held by the American Type Culture Collection under accession number ATCC 29999T.
The EMBL accession number of the 16s rRNA gene sequence of strain DSM 3368 (paratype of ATCC 29999T) (Rainey et al., 1995) is X82248.
